alert.note: Alert for Knox; Lincoln; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following counties, Knox, Lincoln and Waldo. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Leaf debris could lead to poor drainage and ponding of water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockland, Belfast, Camden, Lincolnville, Bristol, Bremen, Thomaston, Rockport, Warren, and Islesboro.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
